intro: Dileptium diffusum, commonly known as the spreading dileptium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in compound umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Dileptium diffusum is often found in rich, loamy soils and is an important component of understory vegetation in eastern forests.
